channel.title: Linux VPS Help
channel.description:
I need help with running my server on my VPS that currently runs on CentOS.
I've had various errors, but the most dominant that keeps occurring is the one that says .cfg files are missing.
Several users have recommended that I go through each .cfg file and change / to \ or something. I'd like to get this done today, though I'm not sure if it's really / to \. Does anyone know what I really need to change it to? I'd appreciate any help because I've posted various threads on problems like this and absolutely [b]no one[/b] attempts to help.

item.title: Linux VPS Help
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Rules: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,331370.0.html

Number 1:[quote]
1. All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server. Any non-server related questions will be locked.
Requesting a host, ‘coder’/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server
related. That means for other sections on this site too.
[/quote][/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Linux VPS Help
item.dc:creator: @David_Shift David Shift
item.description:
@David_Shift wrote:

I don’t see how it’s not allowed, he’s still asking for help on a server problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux VPS Help
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Rules: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,331370.0.html

Number 1:[quote]
1. All topics in this section must be requests for help on a server. Any non-server related questions will be locked.
Requesting a host, ‘coder’/programmer, server or client, or asking about a VPS also falls under being non-server
related. That means for other sections on this site too.
[/quote][/quote]

Wow, that doesn’t make any sense, seeing as virtual private servers do have to do with your server since it’s what it’s hosted on… No wonder no one comes to Mopar anymore. Alrighty, well, can a moderator please close this thread? I’ll be heading over to R-S again, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Linux VPS Help
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

I Vain I:

Not supposed to talk about VPSs. So, try searching Google.

Discussion about virtual private servers is disallowed? May I ask why?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

I need help with running my server on my VPS that currently runs on CentOS.

I’ve had various errors, but the most dominant that keeps occurring is the one that says .cfg files are missing.

Several users have recommended that I go through each .cfg file and change / to \ or something. I’d like to get this done today, though I’m not sure if it’s really / to . Does anyone know what I really need to change it to? I’d appreciate any help because I’ve posted various threads on problems like this and absolutely no one attempts to help.
